channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MO
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MO

item.title: Report X-2024031346
item.description:
Report X-2024031346

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-29T18:14:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-23
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: steel drum was found leaking in a plastic bag. It was taken back to the cage for inspection. Upon inspecting the drum it was noted that there were several dents in the lid DescribePack: dents in the top of the drum DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: the package was put in a plastic lined tote and placed into the hazmat cage

  • Description: SequenceEvent: radio call from Load side about leaking hazmat. upon inspection discoved leaking white powder coming from a hole at the bottom of the box. DescribePack: not clear where the leak was coming from on the bucket but noticed some damage to plastic bucket near bottom where it was leaking from the hole in the bottom of box DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in Haz tote and Brought to QA damaged Hazmat area for processing.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: While unloading a trailer a box was taken off and it was wet on the top half of the box. The box was segregated and taken QA for processing. DescribePack: The package had 4 inner bottles and 2 of them had loose caps therefore; the bottles leaked out into the box. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: The box was placed inside a tote and segregated from other packages.

item.title: Report X-2024031004
item.description:
Report X-2024031004

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-25T15:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-16
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: FULLY LABELED HAZ-MAT IRREG SHIPMENT WAS DISCOVERED DRIPPING LIQUID AND EMITTING A SOLVENT-LIKE ODOR BY THE UNLOAD SUPERVISOR IN SECTION-B DOOR 13 ON THE CATWALK. WITHOUT TOUCHING THE AREA HE EVACUATED THE AREA AND CONTACTED THE DMP. A DESINGNATED RESPONDER ARRIVED WITHIN 2 MINUTES WITH A FULLY STOCKED SPILL CART AND DONNING THE PROPER PPE. THE DAMAGE WAS CONTAINED AND A SMALL 6" RADIUS PUDDLE CLEANED UP, THEN ALL AFFECTED MATERIALS WERE TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. CLOSER INSPECTION REVEALED A MINISCULE PIN-HEAD SIZE PUNCTURE HOLE AT THE CORNER OF THE BASE OF A 5-GAL POLY, CLOSED HEAD PAIL.

item.title: Report X-2024030992
item.description:
Report X-2024030992

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-25T15:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-15
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A FULLY LABELED HAZMAT PACKAGE THAT APPEARED TO BE LEAKING WAS DISCOVERED BY AN UNLOADER IN THE TRAILER ON BAY 51. THE UNLOADER LEFT THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HIS SUPERVISOR. WITHIN 5 MINUTES A DMP RESPONDER ARRIVED DONNING THE CORRECT PPE AND USING THE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET, DETERMINED THAT THE PACKAGE COULD BE SAFELY TRANSPORTED BACK TO THE DMP. UPON FURTHER INSPECTION IT WAS REVEALED THAT THE CAP ON ONE OF THE INNER PLASTIC CONTAINERS WAS CRACKED AND LOOSE BY 1/6 OF A TURN, RESULTING IN TWO OUNCES OF LIQUID LEAKING OUT ONTO THE OUTER CARTON. THERE WAS NO PACKING MATERIAL.
